\chapter{Indices and tables}

\chapter{mamba module}
\label{\detokenize{index:mamba-module}}\label{\detokenize{index:module-mamba}}\index{mamba (module)}
This is the current implementation of \sphinxquotedblleft{}mamba\sphinxquotedblright{} which is a database layout
that sites directly on top of LMDB. Currently it's \sphinxstyleemphasis{much} faster than
Mongo, but currently incomplete and untested .. but it's great for 
playing with.

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
When creating an index we need to be able to specify a list of fields for a compound index

\item {} 
We need an index-aware record update routine

\item {} 
We need a search routine that can handle an index an a filter

\end{itemize}
\end{sphinxadmonition}

Bases: \sphinxcode{object}

\item {}

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\index{Index (class in mamba)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:mamba.Index}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxstrong{class }\sphinxcode{mamba.}\sphinxbfcode{Index}}{\emph{env}, \emph{name}, \emph{func}, \emph{conf}}{}
Bases: \sphinxcode{object}

Representation of a table index created one per index when the table and it's indexes are opened.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{env} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{Environment}) -- An LMDB Environment object

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{name} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{str}) -- The name of the index we're working with

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{func} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{str}) -- Can be a function used to generate index keys, or a field name

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{conf} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{dict}) -- Configuration options for this index

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\begin{sphinxadmonition}{note}{Note:}
if \sphinxstylestrong{func} begins with a \sphinxstylestrong{!} it is taken to be a function, otherwise
it func is treated as a field name. The field type is dictated by the settings
supplied in \sphinxstylestrong{conf}.
\end{sphinxadmonition}

\index{index() (mamba.Table method)}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index:mamba.Table.index}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{index}}{\emph{name}, \emph{func=None}, \emph{duplicates=False}, \emph{integer=False}}{}
Return a reference for a names index, or create if not available
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{name} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{str}) -- The name of the index to create

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{func} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{str}) -- A specification of the index, !\textless{}function\textgreater{}\textbar{}\textless{}field name\textgreater{}

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{duplicates} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{bool}) -- Whether this index will allow duplicate keys

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{integer} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{bool}) -- Whether this index has integer keys (or string keys)

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A reference to the index, created index, or None if index creation fails

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
{\hyperref[\detokenize{index:mamba.Index}]{\sphinxcrossref{Index}}}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}
